data.text:
Andy Roddick Biography

Andy Roddick is known for his quick wit and as the last American tennis player to win a Grand Slam title and be world number one. Roddick was the 2003 U.S. Open champion and a four-time Grand Slam runner-up. When he became number on November 3rd, 2003, the 21 year old was the youngest American at the top spot since computer rankings began in 1973. Roddick officially retired from tennis in 2012. He has explored the media world, co-hosting a national weekend radio show on Fox Sports Radio and joining Fox Sports 1 as an analyst since the network’s launch. Roddick has endorsed many high profile brands including Lexus, American Express, Rolex, Powerade, and Microsoft Xbox. He started the Andy Roddick Foundation to assist lower income children with education. Roddick is the 2004 recipient of the Arthur Ashe Award for his various charity undertakings. He is married to actress and model Brooklyn Decker.

Book Andy Roddick for your Next Event

Our speakers bureau does not claim to exclusively represent Andy Roddick. We then confirm the sports celebrity fee based on the details of the request. The fees listed on the speaker profile are rough estimates based on the previous market rate for the talent. Our team then works with Andy Roddick's agent, manager or assistant on the booking request. For parties interested in hiring Andy Roddick, we recommend filling out the booking request form so our booking agents can help with making your next event a success.
